Reporting

picnic.workflows.reports.advanced_colorbar_limits(image)[source]

calculate the colorbar limits by reducing the weight of the edge most voxels

Parameters

image - nibabel.Nifti1Image obj

the pet image we are trying to get the colorbar limit from

paste together images

Parameters

image - list

a list of all the images that will be pasted together

picnic.workflows.reports.camra_summary(base_file, overlay_files, rank_list, mats=None, rank=1, basename='motion_correction')[source]

wrap the necessary steps to create a desired subsidiary of the *image summary

Parameters

base_file - file-like string

the base image (aka T1)

overlay_files - list of file-like strings

the camra attempts

mats - list

a list of all the transformation matrices

rank - int

which camra method was picked

basename - string

the basename for the output filename

basename - string

picnic.workflows.reports.create_mp4_from_image_list(image_list, output_filename, fps=2)[source]

create a movie from a list of Image objects

Parameters

image_list - list of Images

list of mosaic images

output_filename - string

must be a movie file type (.mp4)

fps - int

frames per second

wrap the necessary steps to create a desired subsidiary of the *image summary

Parameters

the base image

moco_file - file-like string

the motion corrected image

mats - list

a list of all the transformation matrices

ref_frame - int

picnic.workflows.reports.plot_anat(image, cut_coords_bounds, cmap='gray', vmin=None, vmax=None, n_cuts=7)[source]

use nilearn.plotting to plot the anatomy

Parameters

image - nibabel.Nifti1Image

the nibabel image

cut_coords_bounds - dict

the cut bounds in xyz (mm); must contain ‘x’, ‘y’ and ‘z’ key

cmap - string

color map

vmin - float

the min value for the color map

vmax - float

the min value for the color map

picnic.workflows.reports.plot_camra_graph(t, all_dof, idx, autoselect=None)[source]

create pyplots for motion correction

Parameters

t - numpy array

time

all_dof - numpy array

x, y, z, rx, ry, rz in an array

idx - int

denote which frame we are looking at

autoselect -int

denote the reference frame

picnic.workflows.reports.plot_camra_image(base_image, overlay_image, cut_coords_bounds, cmap='jet', alpha=0.5, vmin=None, vmax=None, title=None)[source]

use nilearn.plotting to plot the ortho for motion correction

Parameters

the nibabel image

overlay_image - nibabel.Nifti1Image

the nibabel image

cut_coords_bounds - dict

the cut bounds in xyz (mm); must contain ‘x’, ‘y’ and ‘z’ key

color map

alpha - float

the opacity number

vmin - float

the min value for the color map

vmax - float

the min value for the color map

picnic.workflows.reports.plot_coregistration(overlay_image, base_image, cut_coords_bounds, cmap='jet', n_cuts=7, alpha=0.7, vmin=None, vmax=None)[source]

use nilearn.plotting to plot the anatomy

Parameters

image - nibabel.Nifti1Image

the nibabel image

cut_coords_bounds - dict

the cut bounds in xyz (mm); must contain ‘x’, ‘y’ and ‘z’ key

cmap - string

color map

n_cuts - int

how many images per row

alpha - float

the opacity of the image

vmin - float

the min value for the color map

vmax - float

the min value for the color map

picnic.workflows.reports.plot_image_overlay(overlay_image, base_image, cut_coords_bounds, direction='y', cmap='gray', n_cuts=5, alpha=0.7, vmin=None, vmax=None)[source]

use nilearn.plotting to plot the anatomy

Parameters

image - nibabel.Nifti1Image

the nibabel image

cut_coords_bounds - dict

the cut bounds in xyz (mm); must contain ‘x’, ‘y’ and ‘z’ key

direction - str

the direction we are looking at. Should be ‘x’, ‘y’ or ‘z’

cmap - string

color map

n_cuts - int

how many images per row

alpha - float

the opacity of the image

vmin - float

the min value for the color map

vmax - float

the min value for the color map
